issue.description: FOREWORD ISO has requrested a different foreword for AP203 TS. This is a rewrite of 203 e1 but is not really a second edition (of a TS) so must treat accordingly. There is also request for including words about the TCs Here is ISO comment. The explanation given in the Foreword as to the way this Technical Specification has evolved ought really to be reworded, in order to clarify which documents have been involved. In actual fact, the present document is strictly the first edition of ISO/Technical Specification 10303-203, because the document ISO 10303-203 published in 1994 was a straight International Standard, and the document published in 2000 was an Amendment of the IS (but not strictly a second edition, in ISO terms). Mention should also be made of the three Technical Corrigenda that have been published. In light of the above, I suggest a modified sentence in the Foreword along the following lines: "ISO/TS 10303-203:2005 cancels and replaces ISO 10303-203:1994, its Amendment Amd. 1:2000 and its Technical Corrigenda, Cor. 1:1996, Cor. 2:1998 and Cor. 3:2004."

issue.description:
No way to handle ISO version, as in the object identifier of annex Information object registration. application_protocol.xml/application_protocol/@version refers to the ISO edition. From reading 10303-1 4.3, the edition number of a standard or tech spec is the same number, by convention, as the version field of the information object identifer, only for edition 1 of a new part number.
After that, something must be different. From reading 8824, International standards and Technical Specifications share the same iso information object identifier space. They are "standard"s. SO if they have the same part number, something else must be different - that is the version. For example a draft of some contents of 203 second edition is being as a TS, then published as DIS then IS. SO we have object id version 1 is first ed, version 2 is first edition of TS, version 3 is 2nd ed DIS, vers,xion 4 will be 2nd edtion IS.
